column4: Hello channel! Dunno if this is the appropriate channnel. I have a dir with ~500 files, named by a convention that gives me no way to filter them. I have three lists of file names, the files in each of which I want to put into a folder. Any ways to do this efficiently?

Hello channel! Dunno if this is the appropriate channnel. I have a dir with ~500 files, named by a convention that gives me no way to filter them. I have three lists of file names, the files in each of which I want to put into a folder. Any ways to do this efficiently?
xargs ? or a while loop ?
more help in #bash probably
maybe, a bit more detailed?
yeah thanks
something like ---> while IFS= read -r file; do mv -- "$file" dir1/ ; done < file_with_finames
repeat for the other files
follow this http://astrophysics.wikidot.com/install-vpfit
is for ubuntu 9.04 but should still work ?
thanks but I tried and it didn't work. Odd, since it did on another machine (different architecture) a couple of months ago
what is the error you get ?
hang on I'll try and find the first one in the output
here is my output
have you installed build-essebtials ?
check
:( then i dunno; pthreads should be aviable in libc6-dev ?
found this libpthread-stubs0-dev have you got this istalled ?
some are but not the one named - is it a dumbed down version that Ubuntu installs, or maybe I need an extra package...?
bump - are there extra packages of pthread libs I can possibly want to install?
i only found this libpthread-stubs0-dev as i said earlier ...
sorry didn't see that message
